intro: Traganum acuminatum, commonly known as the spiny pigweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family, characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, spike-like clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Traganum acuminatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in harsh, saline environments. Its adaptability makes it a common weed in agricultural areas, though it also has traditional uses in some regions.
